cscie160.hw7.jUnit

Class ATMTestBase

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.rmi.server.RemoteObject
      • java.rmi.server.RemoteServer
        • java.rmi.server.UnicastRemoteObject
          • cscie160.hw7.jUnit.ATMTestBase
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ATMListener, java.io.Serializable, java.rmi.Remote
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    ATMClientTest, ATMImplementationTest

    public abstract class ATMTestBase
extends java.rmi.server.UnicastRemoteObject
implements ATMListener
    Abstract base for single-JVM and RMI tests.
    Author:
    Andy Kovtun
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • testDeposit

        public void testDeposit()
                 throws java.rmi.RemoteException
        Test method for project.BankATM.intf.ATM#deposit(int, float). Failing test if exception is thrown, or resulting balance after deposit is wrong.
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException

      • testWithdraw

        public void testWithdraw()
                  throws java.rmi.RemoteException
        Test method for project.BankATM.intf.ATM#withdraw(int, float). Failing test if exception is thrown (including overdraft), or resulting balance after withdraw is wrong.
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException

      • testGetBalance

        public void testGetBalance()
                    throws java.rmi.RemoteException
        Test method for project.BankATM.intf.ATM#getBalance(int). Failing test if exception is thrown. Also, asserting on the balance is zero (since we're operating on the newly created ATMImplementation object)
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException

      • handleOverdraftException

        protected abstract void handleOverdraftException(java.rmi.RemoteException e)
                                          throws java.rmi.RemoteException
        Helper method for handling an expected exception on overdraft.
        Should analyze the thrown exception and:
      • return without error if the exception was caused by overdraft
      • rethrow, if there was another root cause
Parameters:
e - The exception thrown (presumably) by overdraft detected.
Throws:
java.rmi.RemoteException
See Also:
cscie160.project.junit.ATMClientTest#handleOverdraftException(RemoteException), cscie160.project.junit.ATMImplementationTest#handleOverdraftException(RemoteException)

  • testOverdraft

    public void testOverdraft()
                   throws java.rmi.RemoteException
    Testing use case of overdraft attempt. Failing unless balance stays unchanged after the failed attempt, or if ATMException is not thrown on the call to getBalance().
    Throws:
    java.rmi.RemoteException

  • ping

    public void ping()
          throws java.rmi.RemoteException
    Description copied from interface: ATMListener
    Method to test if the RMI connection is still alive. Recommended to override with empty method; if not, make sure the method is cheap to execute.
    Alternate usage: make implementation emulate TCP drop by throwing RemoteException.
    Specified by:
    ping in interface ATMListener
    Throws:
    java.rmi.RemoteException
